snippet: The Local 1811 of the Amalgamated Transit Union said the decision for its 8,800 drivers and matrons to strike was essentially about children’s safety.
abstract: New York City’s largest union for school bus drivers plans to strike for the first time since 1979, move that would affect more than 150,000 students; Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, denouncing plan, says city is ready with array of backup steps to support children and their families; union says goal is to preserve job protection for most experienced drivers when transportation vendors who employ them lose city contracts.
lead_paragraph: The Local 1811 of the Amalgamated Transit Union said the decision for its 8,800 drivers and matrons to strike was essentially about children’s safety.
